data.title: Spooky fun for family visiting
data.text: We had a nice evening walking around, learning some history and having fun with ghosts! This is a walking tour, so dress appropriately with good walking shoes.

data.title: Really fun!
data.text: As a long-time Greensboro resident, this was something fun and different to do. I learned a lot about the city's history and Dan and Jessi were very entertaining and great storytellers.

data.title: Awesome experience!
data.text: Great tour that went over the history about reported haunting. Learned a lot about the city. Would be awesome for people who are new to the city or people who've lived there for years.

data.title: Super Fun and Informative Haunted Tour!
data.text: We decided, on a Full Moon night, to take a Haunted Tour in Greensboro.  We lived here for a while but learned so much about our city and it's shady, disturbing and haunted past.  You really need to try it out!  Our tour guide was kitchy, scary and FUN!!!  This tour is not for those who cannot walk a great distance or do not have good batteries on their Hoveround or Rascal. Super fun and incredibly neat tour of our great city.

data.title: Spooky fun!
data.text: We took the tour in Greensboro under a full moon and loved every moment. It was great to learn so much about the history of my hometown. Our guides were very professional, knowledgeable, and were very engaging storytellers. I was surprised to learn that our tour was Jessi's first night...she already seems like a pro! Thanks for a memorable evening, we're looking forward to taking the tours in other cities soon!

data.title: Family fun
data.text: We learned so much more about the city we have called home for the last 4 years. Our daughter are 12 and 9 and it was awesome to give them this knowledge too. We will return!

data.title: Good Time
data.text: I've lived in Greensboro for years, and wasn't even aware this tour existed until recently.  The weather was perfect, cool and crisp, and the moon was full.  Topher was our guide as our group of 20 traipsed around Elm Street, listening to the nightmarish tales and legends of my adopted home town.  He was engaging and knowledgeable; my friend who was born and raised in Greensboro learned some things she didn't know.  I will be forever conscious of how the railroad is central to Greensboro history, for both good and bad.

data.title: Haunted Walking Tour in Greensboro, NC
data.text: This walking tour featured stories about the history of Greensboro, as well as hauntings of certain buildings.  Chris, our tour guide did a fabulous job. He spoke plainly and very antimated.  Our Belgian guest could understand him completely.  His stories were fascinating as well as informative.  The tour lasted about 1 1/2 hours, but seemed like 5 minutes.  Chris was dressed in vintage attire from the early days in Greensboro, and carried a lantern.  The entire group listened intently to his every word. Our friends loved the tour and all agreed that they would like to do it again.  We are from the area, but never knew most of the things he pointed out to us.  Fun way to spend a Saturday night!  We ate at the Marshall Free House, which is where the tour ended.  Would recommend both to everyone.

data.title: Dan was great
data.text: Had a great tour with Dan. Although Hurricane Matthew was showing its ugly self there was a good turnout. Would absolutely do this tour and others again!

data.title: Greensboro Ghost Tour
data.text: Excellent job by guide around downtown Greensboro.  I've been on dozens of tours in Charleston, SC, Salem, Mass., and Savannah, Georgia.  This guide's storytelling skills are excellent and being born and raised in Greensboro and a history buff myself, all of his information was accurate.  It was an excellent ghost and history tour in one.

data.title: Fun experience
data.text: The tour guise was a great storyteller and I had no idea how many ghost stories there were in Greensboro. Also learned a lot about the area and the history. Very fun experience.

data.title: It was a dark and stormy night......
data.text:
CAROLINA HISTORY & HAUNTS TOUR - GREENSBORO 
Running Time: APPROX. 1 hour 30 minutes 
09.03.16 

It was a dark and stormy evening, no...really it was a dark and stormy evening! Tropical Storm Hermine had decided that she was going to add a little ambiance to our tour. 

Our tour guide for the evening was none other than Dan Riedel, co-owner of the touring company and Emerywood resident. He and his wife, Bridgette own the touring company and have recently dedicated their time to making this company very successful! There are other tour guides, of course, in the two cities they currently tour: Greensboro and Charlotte. We had the pleasure of walking through downtown with Dan. We began our tour through the shadowy streets of Greensboro at the Municipal Building on Washington Street. Dressed in period attire, he asked the tour who believed in ghosts. Almost every hand went up. He said his goal for the evening was to not only share with us the ghost stories that were part of Greensboro but also the history behind them and the area of downtown. Dan said his tours differed from some ghost tours as they don't hire actors to jump out and scare you, although he did say it was downtown Greensboro and you never know what will happen. I won't share all of the stories here as I wouldn't be able to tell them with the excitement and passion that he does. As someone who moved to North Carolina some years ago, I never truly knew the history of the area. It was nice to hear about various areas of Greensboro and how that history affects what we see and hear today. We walked through darkened alleys to hear stories of bones within walls. That story was only interrupted a few moments by a female operatic singer from a local bar. Yes, it was one of those nights in downtown. You stand near the train tracks in downtown as you are told about Hamburger Square in Greensboro. The history of the city during the Civil War. The tornado that hit downtown, yes a tornado hit downtown Greensboro. You walk past brothels and hear tales of the patrons. Greensboro once had a red light district that would have probably rivaled those in Amsterdam. You walk through and over former graveyards which are now sidewalks and parking lots. All under the watchful eyes of the keepers. (Alley cats making sure you behave). Strolling past the Carolina Theatre you can only imagine what the ghosts there must think of all the attention to them. Our tour ended at the Biltmore Hotel, well, the alley behind the Biltmore. We were told of Lydia and Phillip. Two ghosts, which inhabit the Biltmore and if I might guess, probably the two most had heard of from the area. Respect those that have passed. 

The tour offers so much more than just scary stories, entertainment or a way to pass the time. It offers up history of the city of Greensboro. I am looking forward to the Winston-Salem tour which should begin a couple of weeks.

data.title: Great fun
data.text: This was a very fun and educational tour. The city is very walkable, and the tour guide very engaging and entertaining. Totally worth it!

data.title: "A Night Of Ghostly Fun!"
data.text: Having recently visited Asheville and taken their ghost walk, I have to admit that our walk here in Greensboro actually was more interesting & informative. Plus the storyteller here in Greensboro kept the crowds attention more also. And I never knew there were so many spooky places here in Greensboro!

data.title: Perfect Night Out
data.text: My girlfriend and I took the tour, and we had a blast! Everyone in our group was so friendly. Our guide, Topher, was phenomenal. Could not ask for a better experience. I recommend everyone to take the tour, as you will learn so much about the history of Greensboro and some neat hauntings.

data.title: You never wknow what might be around you...
data.text: Our guide, Dan, is a great story teller and had us hooked from the first few minutes.  He walked us around to familiar sites but told us not so familiar stories about things that have been reported.  The back stories added some creepiness to the stories.  Learned a lot about Greensboro and had a very enjoyable time.

data.title: highly recommend this tour
data.text: went with a friend, we were the only 2 on the tour. Topher was very informative and personable! you can really tell he enjoys and dedicates himself to what he does. the tour itself was very interesting and not too bad of a walk. would definitely recommend this to anyone looking for something to do. definitely stood out to me, and will have the ticket on my wall for a long time

data.title: Great History Lesson
data.text: Having lived here my entire life, it was fun to learn about some of Greensboro history that I was unaware of. Topher was great and informative and even stayed after the tour to answer some more of our questions

data.title: Spooky history
data.text: My friend came for a visit from Arizona and, just for fun, we decided to go on the ghost tour.  As it turned out, we had even more fun than we'd hoped for; our guide, Dan, was a wonderful storyteller whose tales of local haunts raised real goosebumps.  More than that, however, he described episodes from Greensboro's history in a way that made them almost visible.  I highly recommend this experience to everyone who enjoys a good shiver and to anyone who appreciates the past.

data.title: Greensboro Ghost Walk
data.text: Very good tour! We have three children ages 7, 11, & 13. And they all had a good time. Very interesting story telling and nice tour through a beautiful city! Topher was very nice and answered all our 7 year olds questions. Thank you.
